title: Why we use our own hardware
author: nmjenkins
aiHeadline: Breaking News: Fastmail Reveals the Shocking Truth Behind Their Use of Custom Hardware, and Honestly, It's About Time Someone Did Something About Those Slow Servers, Because Who Doesn't Love a Good Hardware Upgrade?

title: Rosetta 2 creator leaves Apple to work on Lean full-time
author: ladberg
aiHeadline: In a Stunning Move, Rosetta 2 Creator Jumps Ship from Apple to Pursue Lean Full-Time, Proving That Even the Most Talented Engineers Can't Resist the Lure of a Good Side Hustle, and Who Can Blame Them, Really?

title: Decoding the telephony signals in Pink Floyd's 'The Wall'
author: matthiasl
aiHeadline: Get Ready for a Blast from the Past as Some Brave Soul Decodes the Telephony Signals in Pink Floyd's 'The Wall', Because What's More Fun Than Uncovering the Secrets Behind a 40-Year-Old Album, and Maybe, Just Maybe, Uncovering Some Hidden Messages from the Universe?

title: GPT-5 is behind schedule
author: owenthejumper
aiHeadline: The AI Apocalypse Has Been Delayed: GPT-5 is Officially Behind Schedule, and We Can All Breathe a Sigh of Relief, Because Who Needs Artificial Intelligence Taking Over the World When We Have Enough Problems with Humans in Charge, and Now We Have a Little More Time to Prepare for the Inevitable Robot Uprising?

title: How bloom filters made SQLite 10x faster
author: avinassh
aiHeadline: In a Stunning Turn of Events, Bloom Filters Have Made SQLite 10x Faster, and We're Not Sure What's More Impressive, the Fact That Someone Figured Out How to Make Databases Run Faster or the Fact That They Managed to Make a Blog Post About it Sound Actually Interesting, but Either Way, Our Database-Admin Friends Are Probably Doing the Happy Dance Right Now
